docs.snippet: The Prince Albert rounded the fort at the Narrows yesterday morning, at 10 1/2 o'clock, and was immediately boarded by the Health-Officer and the reporters of the Press.

headline.main: THE BURNING OF THE AUSTRIA.; LIST OF THOSE KNOWN TO LOST. Thrilling Statements from the Survivors. FULL PARTICULARS OF THE DISASTER. Ten of the Austria's Passengers, Saved by the Maurice, Brought into Port. Arrival of the Prince Albert.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Prince Albert rounded the fort at the Narrows yesterday morning, at 10 1/2 o'clock, and was immediately boarded by the Health-Officer and the reporters of the Press.

docs.snippet: JAMES LEWIS HATCH, assistant editor of the Charleston (S. C.) Courier, died on the evening ?? Saturday, the 25th inst., after five days' illness, of ?llow fever. Mr. HATCH was a native of Oxford County, ??., and was only twenty-five years of age when...
docs.lead_paragraph: JAMES LEWIS HATCH, assistant editor of the Charleston (S. C.) Courier, died on the evening ?? Saturday, the 25th inst., after five days' illness, of ?llow fever. Mr. HATCH was a native of Oxford County, ??., and was only twenty-five years of age when he died. He was educated at Bowdoin College, in his native State, where he was graduated in 1854. His College rank was very high.

byline.original: From Our Own Correspondent. F. W. R. PHILO WHITE

headline.main: NEW-GRANADA.; No Revolution in Panama--The Liberal Candidate Declared Governor -- Threats Against the Assembly--Death of a New-York Special Correspondent--Wreck of a Prussian Ship--Outrage on American Property at Panama--Naval Intelligence --A New Consulate in Chili--Passenger Ships to California. CENTRAL AMERICA. Guatemala--Our Minister's Visit to Honduras--The Honduras Railroad Given Over--Salvador--Popularity of Barrios--Increase in Cotton and Coffee Planting--Refusal to Grant an Excquatur to an American Consul--Nicaragua--The Threatened Lauding of Armed Men from the United States Frigate Saranac--A Call for Gentlemanly Consuls--Costa Rica--Attack of Bandittl on the President's House--The National Bank of Costa Rica--Rich Discovery of Silver Ore. GUATEMALA. SALVADOR. NICARAGUA. NEWS BY THE MOSES TAYLOR. SOUTH AMERICA. COSTA RICA. SOURTH AMERICA. Settlement of Ecuador Questions--Castilla Elected President of Peru--American Vessels in Callao all Chartered-- Bolivia Quiet--Export Duty on Ores Abolished--Improvement of Busi

docs.lead_paragraph: That long-expected and much-talked about event, the revolution, that was to have come off on the 15th September, on the occasion of the scrutiny of the ballots for Governor of the State of Panama, was postponed indefinitely, the Government Party, after all their preparations, threats, and gas, not having the courage to "come to the scratch."

docs.snippet: The Board met at 12 o'clock M., yesterday, al the members present except the City Inspector. The Health Officer reported the steamer Star of the South, from Savannah. She had no passengers. It was ordered that she lie at quarantine at present for...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Board met at 12 o'clock M., yesterday, al the members present except the City Inspector. The Health Officer reported the steamer Star of the South, from Savannah. She had no passengers. It was ordered that she lie at quarantine at present for observation.
